metadata.feature_description: Core functionality for creating and managing multi-column layouts on pages, including default layout creation and column configuration.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Get existing layout for a module

steps.action: Navigate to Home page with Content Layout modules
steps.expected: Page loads with existing Content Layout modules visible
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully showing Module 364 (2-column layout) and Module 365 (4-column layout)

steps.action: Enter edit mode and observe layout structure
steps.expected: Layout panes should be visible with their identifiers
steps.actual: 2-column layout shows F30A_Pane1 and F30A_Pane2; 4-column layout shows 9977_Pane1, 9977_Pane2, 9977_Pane3, 9977_Pane4

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify column sizes are properly saved

steps.expected: Columns should display with configured sizes
steps.actual: 2-column layout (Module 364) displays with two panes (F30A_Pane1 and F30A_Pane2) containing content modules

steps.expected: Four columns should be visible with proper sizing
steps.actual: 4-column layout (Module 365) displays 9977_Pane1-4 containing HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, and CAMERAS modules respectively

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify CSS classes are generated correctly

steps.action: Inspect layout panes in edit mode
steps.expected: Each pane should have appropriate CSS classes for styling and positioning
steps.actual: Pane elements have 'pane' class with Bootstrap grid classes. F30A_Pane labels visible indicating proper pane identification. Column resizer element visible between columns.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test layout rendering in edit mode

steps.expected: Layouts should render with editing UI elements visible
steps.actual: Edit mode displays pane labels (F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, 9977_Pane1-4), module action bars on hover, Add Existing Module links, and column resizer handle (gray circle)

steps.expected: Discard and Publish buttons should be visible
steps.actual: Discard and Publish buttons visible in edit bar at bottom of page. Module action menus accessible on hover.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test layout rendering in view mode

steps.action: Navigate to page and observe layout rendering
steps.expected: Content modules should render within their designated columns
steps.actual: Content renders correctly within column panes. 2-column layout shows Test Content Created heading in left pane, WEARABLES/TABLETS/TELEVISIONS in right pane. 4-column layout shows product categories across all four columns.

steps.expected: Four distinct columns should be visible with equal sizing
steps.actual: Module 365 displays four columns: 9977_Pane1 (HOME THEATERS), 9977_Pane2 (BLU-RAY PLAYERS), 9977_Pane3 (MONITORS), 9977_Pane4 (CAMERAS). Each column contains one product module with image and label.

observations: The Content Layout module creates dynamic panes with unique prefixes (F30A_, 9977_) based on module/tab combination to prevent pane name conflicts
Column resizer UI (gray circle) appears between columns in edit mode for interactive resizing
Code analysis shows default layout is created automatically when GetLayout is called and no layout exists (CreateDefaultLayout method in ContentLayoutController.cs)
Layout data is stored with ColumnSizes (comma-separated percentages), ColumnCssClasses (Bootstrap grid classes), and AreCustomColumnSizes flag
Page versioning integration is implemented - edit mode shows latest version while view mode shows published version
Module Actions menu items are available for Admin operations (accessible via floating action bar on hover)
